name: Bayesian based MT-SAPHIR rainfall
description: Megha- Tropiques (MT) is a joint Indo-French collaborative satellite mission, which is launched on 12 October 2011.

name: GPS derived Integrated water vapour
description: This dataset contains Integrated Water Vapor (IWV) estimates derived from GPS receivers that comprise the GAGAN TEC network.

name: GSMap ISRO Rain
description: The GSMaP_ISRO is a precipitation product that was developed through the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) - Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency (JAXA) Implementation of Agreement (IA) specific

name: METEOSAT8 Cloud Properties
description: NASA LaRC is operationally generating global cloud properties products using different geostationary satellites.

name: 3D Volumetric TERLS DWRproduct
description: These products contain the 3D volumetric gridded de-cluttered radar reflectivity and de-aliased radial velocity generated from the C-Band Thumba Equatorial Rocket Launching Station (TERLS) DWR Volumet

name: Inland Water Height
description: It is crucial to know how the storage of inland water bodies change over time. Also, hydrological modelling studies face the challenge of decreasing availability of in-situ monitoring data.

name: River Discharge
description: River heights from satellite altimeters (ENVISAT, Jason-2 and SARAL AltiKa) have been derived at two cross-over points along Godavari River.

name: Soil Moisture
description: Data AccessClick Here to access the Science Products .

name: Global Ocean Surface Current
description: The Global Ocean Surface Current defined here as the average current for the top 0 to 30m layer is derived from the synergistic use of three different satellite derived parameters.

name: High Resolution Sea Surface Salinity
description: The Bay of Bengal's high-resolution sea surface salinity has been reconstructed using a Lagrangian technique leveraging satellite data.

name: Indian Mainland Coastal Product
description: SARAL/AltiKa was launched on 25 February 2013 as a joint collaboration mission of ISRO and CNES.

name: Ocean Subsurface
description: Satellite data has been used to reconstruct ocean interior density and velocity anomalies in the Bay of Bengal through the “interior + surface Quasigeostrophic” (isQG) method.

name: Oceanic Eddies Detection
description: The oceanic eddy parameter information was prepared for 24 years (1993 – 2016) over Bay of Bengal using AVISO.

name: Sea Ice Occurrence Probability
description: The Sea Ice Occurrence Probability (SIOP36) data were prepared from 36 years (October 1978 to December 2014) NSIDC sea ice concentration (SIC) data over the Antarctic Region (Cavalieri, 1996).

name: Wave-based Renewable Energy
description: AWARE demonstrates potential renewable energy resource available from ocean waves over Indian Ocean region.
